description: mounted to ivory paper with grey border; three putti; foremost putti holds a cello
markings: stamped at right edge, in black: [PL] Lugt 2092; LLC, in black: [R] Lugt 2184
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, highlighted with white, over red chalk, on blue paper
provenance: Peter Lely, Lugt 2092, partially cropped and redrawn (1618-1680), London; 'William Gibson, London (until 1704, sale, March 3)'; Jonathan Richardson, Sr., Lugt 2184 (1665-1745), London. Thomas Worsley, Hovingham Hall, Yorkshire; by descent to Sir Marcus Worsley. [Richard Day, London, until 1977; sold, July 19, for Â£1,200, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to Mia)
title: Putti Playing Music, Design for a Pendentive
